intro: Rogersonanthus quelchii, commonly known as the Quelch's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other bellflowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Rogersonanthus quelchii is considered a rare and endangered species.
